list_definition.definition: people who do not have jobs

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: a government program to help the jobless.

list_ex_of_english: The change will affect the jobless count, as only benefit claimants are counted in the total.
Jobless growth is not sustainable either in economics or in politics.
Children growing up in council-run homes are statistically many times more likely to leave school without any educational qualifications and to become jobless.
Only three days ago in another place an announcement was made that there were more jobless elsewhere.
We have the farce of trainers being added to the queue of jobless.
However, it does not mean that, because they have the prospect of a jobless future they should be denied the possibility of securing educational qualifications.
Others signed on with corporations as industrial designers, or consultants, but the bulk of architects were simply jobless.
The unit's claim that the monthly count underestimates jobless by up to a third is exaggerated.
